CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant lives in PERSON ( GPE ) .
CARDINAL . She is the owner of a flat in GPE , which she had let to B.F.R.

CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenant on CARDINAL DATE , the applicant informed the tenant of her intention to terminate the lease on expiry of the term on DATE and summoned her to appear before the Rome Magistrate .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , which was made enforceable on DATE , the Rome Magistrate upheld the validity of the notice to quit and ordered that the premises be vacated by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE , the applicant served notice on the tenant requiring her to vacate the LOC .
CARDINAL . On DATE , she served notice on the tenant informing her that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as the applicant was not entitled to police assistance in enforcing the order for possession .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is described in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of ORG GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-V.
